ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Question on Lute of the Howler and Crowd Control
ygData.msgSnippet: I use it alot with great success in the dog captain room in Karnor. Musiker, bard o 47th level ... From: Daniel Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@fuzzbone.com] Sent:
ygData.messageBody:
I use it alot with great success in the dog captain room in Karnor.

Musiker, bard o 47th level

-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@...]
Sent: 17. april 2001 17:31
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Question on Lute of the Howler and Crowd Control


I never liked Pixie Strike - while the percentage was de-nerfed - there IS
a secondary resist - meaning a mob has TWO chances to resist it. I got a
LOT of resists with it (except for mid-to-low blues) and didn't like it...
I stuck to Charm and Root. Others had better results with it than myself.

Slyde

-----Original Message-----
From: Matt DeBarger [mailto:mattdeba@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 17, 2001 8:13 AM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Question on Lute of the Howler and Crowd Control


What lvl are you? If you have the 53 song, you can reliably mez 3 mobs.
With Pixie Strike, you can only reliably mez 2 mobs. I would never mix
charming and mezzing and a single bash can really ruin your mezzing.

For me if there is a 2 pull, I will usually charm (though in Sebillis I now
just mez, since too many of th emobs are over lvl 50).
If there is a 3 or 4 pull I mez. If you are getting 5 pulls you better have
an enchanter or a real good rooter...
